definitions.definition: To acquire, bring in, or introduce.
definitions.example: The ship took on cargo in Norfolk yesterday.

definitions.definition: To begin to have or exhibit.
definitions.example: In the dark, the teddy bear took on the appearance of a fearsome monster.

definitions.definition: To assume or take responsibility for.
definitions.example: I'll take on the project if no one else will.

definitions.definition: To attempt to fight or compete with.
definitions.example: I don't recommend taking on that bully, since he's bigger than you are.

definitions.definition: To (attempt to) dribble round an opposition player.
To catch on, do well; to become popular.
To show emotion, to grieve or be concerned (about something or someone).
To obtain the services of (a person) in exchange for remuneration; to give someone a job.
